name: 英文（三）：科技英文
restrict: ◎必須先修過【英文(一)】◎必須先修過【英文(二)】
description: 本課程旨在加深學生的英語能力，結合與科學及科技等相關主題規劃英語授課內容，期透過主題式課程增進學生興趣並提升英語基本能力及學術應用可能。
goals: 1. 增進學生英語溝通表達能力 2. 透過參與課程活動促進團隊精神 3. 透過多面向英語閱讀促使學生了解多元文化，拓展學生國際化視野 4. 透過課堂討論培養批判精神 5. 提升學生英語學習動機及自主學習興趣
syllabus:
**ENGLISH III—English for Science and Technology**

**Spring Semester 2019**

Goal: The goal of this course is to help students develop their English proficiency so that they will be better able to comprehend and use English in the courses they study in their major and in their daily lives. Through a series of talks, discussions, and projects, students will work on developing their speaking, listening, reading, writing, and vocabulary skills.  

Objectives:

1.      To help students continue to develop the skills they will need to employ when reading, listening, or discussing materials related to science and technology that have been published in English.

2.      To teach students to think critically about the issues addressed in the readings and in class. 

3.      To provide classroom opportunities for the discussion of thoughts and ideas generated from students’ use of critical thinking skills.

4.      To develop students’ presentation skills so that they can effectively prepare and deliver a presentation in English.

5.      To provide opportunities through the use of homework to allow students to show their understanding of the course content. 

6.      To give students opportunities to apply English skills to tasks required for their own majors.    

7.      To introduce students to some of the online resources available in English that are devoted to science and technology topics.  

8.     To provide students with opportunities to explore other materials on science and technology topics that are of global interest. 

Requirements

1.  Attendance and Preparation

It is very important that students attend class on a regular basis and that students prepare any homework assignments.  If you miss class frequently, points will be deducted from your final grade for the course, and it is possible that you may fail the course.  Please arrive for class on time. Continually arriving for class late will be viewed as an absence.  

2.  Participation

It is expected that students will be active participants in the learning process.   

3.  Projects 

Students will be asked to complete a number of individual and group projects related to the material and activities in the textbook.
